clinical_study.brief_title: Spironolactone Plus Metformin in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Metformin Versus Metfotmin Plus Low-dose Spironolactone in the Treatment of Overweight/Obese Patients With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: a Randomized Study

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators examined whether a combined therapy with low-dose spironolactone plus metformin is more effective than metformin alone in 52 overweight/obese Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) patients.

detailed_description.textblock: In the present prospective, randomized study, we evaluated the efficacy of a combined therapy with metformin and low-dose spironolactone as compared to metformin alone on the clinical and endocrine-metabolic alterations of PCOS patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Metformin versus Metformin plus low-dose Spironolactone on metabolic parameters of Patients with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: a randomized study
primary_outcome.description: We evaluated metabolic parameters across anthropometric parameters: height, weight, waist circumference, BMI, glycemia, lipid profile, blood count, coagulation parameters, hepatic and renal function indexes, OGTT and HOMA-IR. The diagnosis of MetS was established according to the ATPIII criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Spironolactone versus Metformin plus spironolactone in hyperandrogenism in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: We evaluated hyperandrogenism across Hirsutism Score, measuring total testosterone, SHBG, Î”4androstenedione, DHEA-S and FAI. All patients underwent ovarian ultrasound examination.

arm_group.description: Metformin 850 mg twice a day for six months plus Spironolactone 25 mg day

intervention.description: Metformin 850 mg twice a day for six months
Metformin 850 mg twice a day for six months plus Spironolactone 25 mg day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Overweight/obese patients with PCOS
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other causes of hyperandrogenism and
- Use of drugs including:
- oral contraceptive
- anti-hypertensive agents
- anti-diabetic drugs
- agents for weight loss
